name: Calling Quiz Nerds
description:
Join us for an engaging afternoon of quizzing that celebrates the world of museums, art, and photography! Presented in association with the Karnataka Quiz Association (KQA), this quiz explores subjects that naturally inspire curiosity and discovery, taking participants on a global cultural journey.

Your hosts for the day are KQA veterans Mahendra Balu and Thejaswi Udupa, who bring decades of quizzing expertise to the podium.

Come ready to test your knowledge and discover fascinating stories from the worlds of culture, creativity, and visual storytelling!

name: The Art of Language
description: Poet, playwright, and academic Mamta Sagar joins Arundhati Ghosh for an intimate conversation on poetry, translation, and the intersections of word and image. Exploring her creative process and her forays into visual art, Mamta reflects on how language transforms into texture, rhythm, and form, offering audiences a rare glimpse into the evolving journey of her work.

name: NeuroQueer Brainbox
description:
A warm invitation to all neurodivergent and queer Folks!
Join us for the 4th edition of NeuroQueer Brain Box facilitated by Mani Agarwal, a NeuroQueer therapist. This session will celebrate the diversity and stories of our bodies. Together, we will explore how our bodies are integral to our identities.
We’ll begin with a guided walk of the exhibition, VISIBLE/INVISIBLE:Representation of Women in Art through the MAP Collection, through a queer lens. As you move through the space, reflect on some words that come up for you; let them resonate with you, and bring them into our group space. Together, through shared reflections and queer perspectives on our bodies, we’ll map our feelings with art. This will be a space to celebrate neuroqueer creativity and build a sense of community, where we spend time with our own bodies to feel seen and affirmed. 
Please note: This is a free session exclusively for individuals who identify as LGBTQIA+ or are individuals with ADHD/Autism/AuDHD.

name: Love Letters - Ninna Preetiya, Naanu!
description:
In an age of instant messages and disappearing stories, the play "Love Letters: Ninna Preetiya Naanu" invites you to pause, reflect, and turn the pages of the past—one heartfelt letter at a time.

This poignant, original Kannada play explores the depth of a lifelong connection between two people bound by nostalgia, affection, and all the words left unsaid. Imagine scrolling through a lifetime of messages—not through DMs, but through yellowing pages, hurried handwriting, and tear-stained notes. From scribbled notes in school notebooks to confessions that arrive too late, the play spans decades of friendship and almost-love.

It's a journey through innocence, longing, and the quiet ache of missed chances—narrated through letters that become both a timeline and a testament to what was, and what might have been.

This performance is in conjunction with the exhibition Shape of a Thought: Letters from Ram Kumar.
